questions.text: Original: 'Despite the overwhelming evidence against his theory, the scientist persisted in defending his controversial hypothesis with unwavering determination.'
options: Even though there was compelling proof that contradicted his theory, the scientist continued to support his debatable hypothesis with steadfast resolve.
Because of the strong evidence supporting his theory, the scientist maintained his controversial position with great determination.
Although the evidence was insufficient, the scientist defended his popular theory with occasional hesitation.
The scientist abandoned his controversial hypothesis due to the overwhelming evidence that supported alternative theories.
questions.explanation: המשפט המקורי מביע ניגוד בין העובדות (ראיות מכריעות נגד התיאוריה) לבין פעולת המדען (המשך הגנה נחושה). האפשרות הנכונה משמרת את המבנה הלוגי: 'למרות ש...' (despite/even though), 'ראיות משכנעות שסותרות' (overwhelming evidence against/compelling proof that contradicted), 'המשיך לתמוך' (persisted in defending/continued to support), ו'נחישות איתנה' (unwavering determination/steadfast resolve). האפשרויות האחרות משנות את המשמעות: האפשרות השנייה הופכת את כיוון הראיות, השלישית משנה את טיב הראיות והעמדה, והרביעית הופכת את פעולת המדען לחלוטין.
examples: Despite the rain, we continued our hike = Even though it was raining, we kept hiking
Notwithstanding the criticism, she maintained her position = Although there was criticism, she held her ground
questions.grammarRule: Despite/In spite of + noun phrase = Even though/Although + clause. Both express contrast but require different grammatical structures.
questions.commonMistakes: Confusing 'despite' (contrast) with 'because of' (cause), or changing 'persisted in defending' to 'abandoned' which reverses the meaning completely.
questions.usageTip: Look for signal words that indicate contrast (despite, although, even though) and ensure the logical relationship between clauses remains identical in the restatement.

questions.text: Original: 'Had the government implemented stricter regulations earlier, the environmental catastrophe could have been averted entirely.'
options: If the government had introduced more stringent rules sooner, the ecological disaster might have been completely prevented.
Since the government failed to implement regulations, the environmental catastrophe was inevitable and occurred as expected.
The government's early implementation of strict regulations directly caused the environmental catastrophe that followed.
Unless the government implements stricter regulations now, future environmental catastrophes will definitely occur.
questions.explanation: המשפט המקורי משתמש במבנה של תנאי מסוג שלישי (third conditional) עם היפוך (inversion): 'Had + subject + past participle' שמשמעותו 'If + past perfect'. המשפט מביע חרטה על פעולה שלא התרחשה בעבר ותוצאותיה. האפשרות הנכונה משמרת את המשמעות: 'אם הממשלה הייתה מכניסה חוקים מחמירים יותר מוקדם יותר, האסון האקולוגי היה יכול להימנע לחלוטין'. האפשרויות האחרות משנות את המשמעות: השנייה מדברת על מה שקרה בפועל, השלישית הופכת את הסיבתיות, והרביעית מדברת על העתיד במקום על העבר.
examples: Had I known about the meeting, I would have attended = If I had known about the meeting, I would have attended
Had she studied harder, she could have passed = If she had studied harder, she could have passed
questions.grammarRule: Third conditional with inversion: 'Had + subject + past participle' = 'If + subject + had + past participle'. Used for hypothetical past situations.
questions.commonMistakes: Confusing third conditional (past hypothetical) with other conditional types, or changing the time reference from past to present/future.
questions.usageTip: When you see 'Had + subject + past participle' at the beginning, it's an inverted third conditional expressing regret or hypothetical past situations.

questions.text: Original: 'Not only did the new policy fail to address the underlying issues, but it also exacerbated the existing problems significantly.'
options: The new policy both failed to tackle the fundamental problems and made the current difficulties considerably worse.
Although the new policy addressed some underlying issues, it created several new problems that were quite serious.
The new policy successfully resolved the underlying issues but unfortunately created some minor additional problems.
While the new policy didn't completely solve all issues, it made significant progress in improving the overall situation.
questions.explanation: המשפט המקורי משתמש במבנה 'Not only... but also' שמדגיש שתי פעולות שליליות: א) הכישלון בטיפול בבעיות הבסיסיות, ב) החמרת הבעיות הקיימות. המבנה הזה מדגיש שהמצב גרוע פי שניים ממה שציפו. האפשרות הנכונה משמרת את שני האלמנטים: 'גם כשלה בטיפול בבעיות הבסיסיות וגם החמירה את הקשיים הנוכחיים באופן משמעותי'. האפשרויות האחרות משנות את המשמעות: השנייה מציינת הצלחה חלקית, השלישית מדברת על הצלחה עם בעיות קלות, והרביעית מציגת תמונה חיובית של התקדמות.
examples: Not only was he late, but he also forgot the documents = He was both late and forgot the documents
She not only speaks French fluently, but also teaches it = She both speaks French fluently and teaches it
questions.grammarRule: 'Not only... but also' emphasizes two related points, often with inversion after 'not only'. Both elements should be parallel in structure.
questions.commonMistakes: Missing the double negative impact - both the failure AND the worsening, or changing one of the negative aspects to positive.
questions.usageTip: When you see 'Not only... but also', ensure both parts of the statement are preserved in the restatement, maintaining the emphasis on two connected points.
